original_title: GMOA accuses Eastern Governor of unprofessional conduct
original_body_lines: GMOA highlights serious concerns of members regarding Thondaman’s conduct during meetings
Says his behaviour has led to an unpleasant working environment within Eastern Province
Asks the Governor to revisit and rectify his behaviour immediately failing which trade union action will be taken

The Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA) has sent a strongly worded missive this week to Eastern Province Governor Senthil Thondaman expressing their concerns regarding his perceived unprofessional behaviour towards medical professionals in the region.
The communique highlighted serious concerns raised by GMOA branch unions and administrative grade officers in the province regarding Thondaman’s conduct during meetings.
“It is alleged that your recent remarks towards doctors during official meetings are not at all acceptable, making your behaviour questionable and unprofessional,” the GMOA said in the letter.

The professional body said their members have therefore conveyed that the Governor’s behaviour has led to an unsatisfactory and unpleasant working environment within Eastern Province, which ultimately may lead to decreased quality of services.

The GMOA warned the Governor that if his conduct remains unaltered, the members of the province will be forced to declare trade union measures and refrain from participating in meetings convened by Thondaman.
The GMOA said considering the requests of its members the Executive Committee has decided to step in and asked the Governor to “revisit” his conduct immediately.

“If we could not observe any positive responses in this regard, we have decided to fully endorse the stance of Branch Unions of GMOA to declare strong trade union measures, against your conduct in future,” it noted.
